intro: Hieracium billyanum var. parvulum, commonly known as the small yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its small yellow flowers are surrounded by pale green leaf-like structures called phyllaries. It is a perennial herb that can spread through rhizomes, making it a common weed in disturbed habitats.
